qas.question: To whom were School Hall and School Library erected in memoriam of?

answers.text: Etonians who had died in the Boer War

qas.question: What destroyed part of the Upper School and Chapel in WWII?
Who was hired to replace windows in the Chapel from 1949-1952?
In what years was Upper School built?
In what years was the Boer War fought?
Who was one of the prominent Etonians who died in the Great War?
Who was one of the prominent Etonians who died in the Boer War?

context: The very large and ornate School Hall and School Library (by <b4_0>L K. Hall<b4_0/>) were erected in <b3_0><b5_0>1906-8<b5_0/><b3_0/> across the road from Upper School as the school's memorial to the <a0_0>Etonians who had died in the Boer War<a0_0/>. Many tablets in the cloisters and chapel commemorate the large number of dead Etonians of the Great War. <a1_0>A bomb<a1_0/> destroyed part of Upper School in World War Two and blew out many windows in the Chapel. The college commissioned replacements by <a2_0>Evie Hone<a2_0/> (1949–52) and by <b7_0>John Piper<b7_0/> and <b6_0>Patrick Reyntiens<b6_0/> (1959 onwards).
